intro: Schizoglossum flavum, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and a short, stout stem that often branches near the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Schizoglossum flavum is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms and specialized structures.
